title: Aircraft Engine Full-Flowpath CFD Solver
tagline: Comprehensive CFD simulation platform for multi-stage engine components
highlights: Equation non-dimensionalization and RANS turbulence modeling for complex internal flows
Jacobian matrix construction and sparse linear system solving using Krylov methods
MPI parallelization with domain decomposition for multi-core scaling
Hardware-software co-design for custom chip deployment and memory optimization
Performance profiling and bottleneck analysis across different computing platforms
summary: Developed a comprehensive CFD simulation platform for multi-stage aircraft engine components (fans, compressors, combustors, turbines), requiring both high accuracy and computational efficiency for engineering design cycles.
goal: Achieve engineering-acceptable accuracy within 2-4 hour time budgets on available computing resources. Ensure solver stability and reproducibility across different hardware platforms while maintaining ±5% accuracy compared to commercial software.
role: Lead solver architect and developer, responsible for numerical scheme implementation, implicit solver optimization, and hardware-software co-design.
results: Achieved 3-5x acceleration on custom chips compared to traditional CPUs for representative test cases, while maintaining engineering accuracy within ±5% of commercial software results. Successfully deployed solver for production use in engine design workflows.

title: HPC Sparse Matrix Solver Optimization
tagline: Improved convergence and parallel efficiency for industrial-scale engine simulations
highlights: Analysis of sparsity patterns in CFD Jacobian matrices and their impact on solver performance
Implementation and comparison of algebraic multigrid (AMG) preconditioners
Development of problem-specific preconditioning strategies for turbomachinery flows
Memory bandwidth optimization and cache-aware data structures
Load balancing algorithms for heterogeneous computing environments
summary: Optimized implicit CFD solver performance by improving preconditioning strategies and parallel scaling for large sparse linear systems.
goal: Improve convergence rate and parallel efficiency for industrial-scale engine simulations. Reduce solver iteration count and achieve >80% parallel scaling efficiency on large core counts.
role: Solver algorithm researcher and optimizer, focusing on preconditioning strategies and parallel scaling.
results: Reduced solver iteration count by 40-60% for compressor and turbine test cases through improved preconditioning. Achieved 85%+ parallel scaling efficiency on up to 1024 cores. Memory usage optimized by 30% through better data structures.

title: AI-Assisted CFD Development Pipeline
tagline: Accelerating development cycles while maintaining code quality and numerical accuracy
highlights: AI-assisted code generation and refactoring for numerical algorithms
Automated parameter optimization using machine learning surrogate models
Performance data analysis and bottleneck identification with AI tools
Code review and testing automation for CFD-specific patterns
Integration of AI tools into existing development workflows
summary: Explored practical applications of AI tools in CFD workflows to accelerate development cycles while maintaining physical understanding and numerical rigor.
goal: Accelerate development cycles while maintaining code quality and numerical accuracy. Target 30%+ reduction in development time for new features and 50%+ improvement in parameter tuning efficiency.
role: AI integration lead, exploring practical applications of AI tools in CFD workflows.
results: Reduced code development time by 35% for new numerical features. Improved parameter tuning efficiency by 50% through AI-assisted optimization. Enhanced code quality with automated review tools catching 25% more potential issues.
